paper.title: HOW DO COUNTRY RISK RATINGS AFFECT TOURISM ACTIVITY? AN INDIRECT MEASURE OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS OF COUNTRIES
paper.abstract: Since the link between tourism and economic growth is not automatic, a country must meet certain characteristics in order for this link to occur and make it sustainable through time. Among these characteristics, environmental and sustainable policies, the existence of hard and soft infrastructure, a regulated labour market and economic and financial indicators play a key role. Therefore, Country Risk Score (CRS) can represent a good indicator of the sustainability of countries. Using Country Risk Score data from 2012 relating to 186 countries and retrieving Tourist Arrivals data from 2012 for the same countries from the World Bank and UNWTO-World Tourism Organization databases, we apply regression analysis to study if there is any relationship between country risk and tourism activity. Results show that there is a strong relationship between the country risk, its indicators of sustainability and the tourism activity of each country clearly giving rise to policymaking implications.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究国家风险评级与旅游活动之间的关系，并探讨了可持续性政策的影响。虽然提到了Country Risk Score，但其研究重点并不在金融领域的衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理，而是更侧重于旅游经济学和政策制定。
